page.title: 02CHANGES IN GRETTON FROM 1918
page.content: Gretton in 1918 was a very different village from the Gretton of the 1980's. Most of the houses were built of stone with thatched roofs. The first council houses were not built until 1921. There was a Wesleyan Chapel in addition to the Parish and Baptist Churches. The streets were lit by oil lamps until electricity was brought to the village in 1931. All water had to be drawn from wells or springs. A mains supply was connected in the late 1940's. Mains sewerage arrived later than that. One interesting building in Gretton seventy five years ago was the "sanctuary". This was particularly helpful to wrong- doers. If anyone who had committed a crime could reach this building and climb up to a little tower at the top with slit windows before being caught by the police, he was a free man.
